verses.text: These were the divisions of the descendants of Aaron. Aaron’s sons were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.comment: Simple list of Aaron’s sons, matches the Hebrew names; same order as other OT passages.

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
verses.comment: Explains why only Eleazar and Ithamar's lines are counted; textual match to Lev. 10:2.

verses.text: With the help of Zadok, a descendant of Eleazar, and Ahimelech, a descendant of Ithamar, David organized them for their service.
verses.comment: Uses 'organized' for clarity (Hebrew: divided); 'descendant' clarifies lineage.

verses.text: There were more leaders among the descendants of Eleazar than among the descendants of Ithamar. So they were divided as follows: sixteen heads from the house of Eleazar, and eight from the house of Ithamar.
verses.comment: Numbers and division clarified as heads/households, following Hebrew text.

verses.text: They were chosen by lot, one group for another, because high officials of the sanctuary and of God were taken from among the descendants of both Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.comment: Phrase 'by lot, one group for another' keeps fairness in selection, matches the pattern of OT sorting.

verses.text: Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a scribe, a Levite, recorded them in the presence of the king, the officials, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the heads of the families of the priests and Levites—one house for Eleazar and one for Ithamar.
verses.comment: Clarifies all present; slight variation as to house/family for transparency.

verses.text: The first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
verses.comment: Lists lots in order; names are transliterated from Hebrew.

verses.text: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
verses.comment: Continued exact retention of priestly family names.

verses.text: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
verses.comment: Maintains literalness of names and order.

verses.text: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
verses.comment: Abijah’s line later referenced in the NT regarding Zechariah.

verses.text: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
verses.comment: Transliteration of Hebrew names as standard.

verses.text: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
verses.comment: Follows temple/chief priest house order.

verses.text: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
verses.comment: Verse structure follows original enumerative pattern.

verses.text: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
verses.comment: These names also found in post-exilic priestly listings.

verses.text: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
verses.comment: Faithful transliteration; names preserved for continuity.

verses.text: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,
verses.comment: Exact to Hebrew text; Jehezkel is Ezekiel.

verses.text: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
verses.comment: Verse follows established list pattern.

verses.text: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
verses.comment: Twenty-four lots complete the priestly courses.

verses.text: These were their appointed orders for their service when they entered the house of the LORD according to the procedure established by their ancestor Aaron, as the LORD God of Israel had commanded him.
verses.comment: Clarifies that these orders are according to God’s law and Aaron’s precedent.

verses.text: The rest of the descendants of Levi were as follows: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
verses.comment: Begins non-priestly Levitical leader list; Amram was Moses' father.

verses.text: Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.
verses.comment: Identifies Isshiah as head of Rehabiah’s house.

verses.text: Of the Izharites: Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
verses.comment: Uses Shelomoth as Hebrew.

verses.text: Sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.comment: Specified by rank; mirroring OT listings.

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel: Micah; of the sons of Micah, Shamir.
verses.comment: Maintained as per genealogical tradition.

verses.text: Micah’s brother was Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
verses.comment: Connects Isshiah as brother of Micah and father of Zechariah.

verses.text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah: Beno.
verses.comment: Genealogy matches earlier census.

verses.text: The descendants of Merari by Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.
verses.comment: Expands Merari line; Beno could mean 'his son'.

verses.text: Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
verses.comment: Short clarifying note; matches genealogical records.

verses.text: Of Kish: the sons of Kish, Jerahmeel.
verses.comment: Kish is another Merarite ancestor.

verses.text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the descendants of the Levites by their ancestral families.
verses.comment: Summing up the Merarite family line.

verses.text: They also cast lots, just as their relatives, the sons of Aaron, did in the presence of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the priestly and Levitical families. The heads of the families and their younger brothers were included alike.
verses.comment: Affirms all participated in the lot process; 'included alike' reflects fairness.
